result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
2:00 PM Defendant David Arnold Belille Jr. appeared by video, in custody from Sawyer County Jail.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for David Arnold Belille Jr.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address. Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.   State makes bond recommendation.  Attny Chapman no objection.  Court sets bond.   SIBS $10,000   COMBINED BOND  22CF261 and 22CF262   No Contact with  9810 N Haskins Road,  W.R.R.  dob: 9/6/1968 Through Counsel, DEF waives time limits for preliminary hearing, but set for preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 21, 2022 at 11:30 am.
